issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A fix has been committed, and will be part of the next release
status.name: Release Pending

fields.description:
I've been testing the demo scripts in the euca-demo project against an 8-node manual build of 4.2. I was able to run my demo-20 simple stack with no trouble (so I don't think I tried to view stack status inside the console), but I'm having some trouble running the demo-30 wordpress workload repatriation demo. Not only am I seeing trouble with running cloudinit within the demo instance (this worked in 4.1.0, 4.1.1, 4.1.2), when I attempted to go into the console to check on status of the stack, via this URL: https://console.hp-gol01-d8.mjc.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com/stacks/WordPressDemoStack, I get a "failed to open page" result.

Viewing the eucaconsole.log, I see many lines like this:
2015-11-09 20:48:25 ERROR demo/admin@10.5.1.106 [iBVVRSLWACLz3lQg]: The specified bucket does not exist

I'm not sure what bucket it's looking for. I have created a "sample-templates" bucket in the eucalyptus account, but I have not uncommented the line in console.ini which would enable this. I do not have a sample-templates bucket in the demo account where I'm attempting to run this demo.

I have confirmed this problem when running the default Nginx proxy, as well as the replacement proxy I have been using instead which handles both the console and UFS via multiple virtual hosts.

Since I've been using my own proxy config, the console.ini has been modified to specify my own PK and CERT:
session.secure = true
sslcert=/etc/pki/tls/certs/star.hp-gol01-d8.mjc.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com.crt
sslkey=/etc/pki/tls/private/star.hp-gol01-d8.mjc.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com.key

But I have not otherwise modified it from the default.

The console is sporadically available from https://console.hp-gol01-d8.mjc.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com/, but I am currently rebuilding this often to test changes to 4.2 manual install scripts, so let me know if you want to take a look and I can make sure it's stable.
fields.summary: Unable to view some CloudFormation Stacks in Console

comments.body:
Would you mind attaching the template(s)?
what is your ufshost set to in the console.ini?

FYI, our sample templates are on the filesystem where the console is running since they get installed with packages. Any templates the user specifies (sample or uploaded) are placed in a bucket we create on their behalf. It looks like this:
cf-template-kt-pw-3y2x6k-dsxwvle3a-euca
where the somewhat random characters are actually hashed from their account name, etc, so it's predictable for the console to find that bucket every time. Might check to see if you have a bucket that is prefixed with cf-template.
[~mcrawford], please when you attach the template, also let us know a login account/username/pw that [~dkavanagh] could use to debug.
hi [~dkavanagh], can you ping [~mcrawford] in lync or via phone to work this out, please? It'll be more efficient.

I *think* this is caused by a stack created by euca2ools, not the console. The "bucket does not exist" is the cf-templates...  bucket that the console creates. If I'm right, it's a simple fix we could get into 4.2.2, but I will do some testing and report back.
[~mcrawford] Could you add your console.ini to this ticket?

I've just added two files
* [^console.ini] - this was modified by [~dkavanagh] to change upshots from localhost to the UFS FQDN - this seems to have fixed the problem.
*   [^demo-20-cfn-simple-20151116.log] - David was concerned that creating the stack via Euca2ools was not creating some bucket needed, this is a log showing me running the "initialize", "run" (portion run live in front of demo audience) and "reset" scripts for my demo-20, which creates a simple cloud formation stack, which worked perfectly this time. I was able to view the stack while being created in the Stack list page, click on the stack and view all 3 tabs of the stack detail. I could view the template which was created. While the stack was being deleted, I could see it in the list page in deleted status, and go into detail and view events, the template, etc.

So, at least for this simple template, all looks good now, changing the upfhost from localhost to FQDN seems to have fixed it.

HOWEVER, please confirm that a new install doesn't have some dependency on a bucket, based on what David suspected, which was satisfied by something he or I did to manually create a stack via the Console. If that is not done, and the first stack created is via Euca2ools, would there be some bucket missing?  I can re-create this PRC 8-node manual system again late tonight, if you want to try this on a fresh install tomorrow, just LMK and I can try and send results.

I'm about to try my WordPress demo, which create a much more complex Stack, this has been failing to signal with cfn-signal when it successfully completes. That's a separate bug, however...
I've created a fix branch. We should decide what release this should go in, [~jloza], [~alice]

Sure. It's very easy to look at the code changes in the branch:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/compare/maint-4.2...GUI-2223

In a nutshell, I prevented error reporting when the code tries to find the bucket to read it, and in the stack view, I handle the no-bucket case just like I was for the no-key case (if the template had been deleted). 95% of the code changes are isolated to the stack_view and I've tested that with and without the template bucket being in place.
[~mcrawford] did you try running the stack from console and not command line? If yes, did you see the same problems?

[~alice], yes, he and I both did and it worked just fine.
In fact, once the stack was created from the console, the template bucket was created and then stacks created from outside the console could be viewed properly.

[~dkavanagh]: Is there a simple way to test this?  I tried using the template attached to this bug but the stack does not get created properly because it's trying use AWS directories that do not exist (/opt/aws).  Is there an easier way to test this?

The way to test is create the stack using euca2ools and then view the stack in the console. The bug was that you couldn't view it w/ the console because we expected the cf-templates-... bucket. Actually, ensure the templates bucket doesn't exist before creating the stack w/ euca2ools.

Verified.  I am able to view the Stack from the GUI after creating it from the back-end.  I was able to reproduce original bug and it did not reproduce in the latest GUI.
{code}
[root@euca-10-111-74-213 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.2.2                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.7676.37.20160106gitb33bdc6.el6   Build Date: Wed 06 Jan 2016 02:26:42 PM PST
Install Date: Wed 20 Jan 2016 03:32:51 PM PST      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-141
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.2.2-0.0.7676.37.20160106gitb33bdc6.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 17948129                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
{code}
